subject: RE: [junit] Re: junit tests and functional/ integration tests
msgSnippet: You might want to take a look at Test Mentor - Java Edition (www.javatesting.com). This tool has a strong component orientation and runs JUnit tests. So in the
messageBody:
You might want to take a look at Test Mentor - Java Edition
(www.javatesting.com). This tool has a strong component orientation and runs
JUnit tests. So in the case you described you would compose your
higher-level tests from lower-level test components that themselves are
based on existing JUnit tests, using test data to drive the flow if
necessary. Since this is a JUnit group and not a Test Mentor group, I will
refrain from going into more detail, but I would be happy to do so off-line.

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Mike Silverstein
SilverMark, Inc.
The object testing company
http://www.javatesting.com
